avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of the snowfall the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent in the late morning. The avalanches can release the moist old snow as well and reach very large size. This applies in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. The fresh snow and the wind slabs can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant,. Up to 2200 m rain will fall from late morning over a wide area. As the moisture increases large moist and wet avalanches are to be expected, in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Wet avalanches can reach a long way in particular in steep gullies. The conditions are critical for backcountry touring and snowshoe hiking.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Significant increase in danger of dry and wet avalanches as a consequence of the precipitation.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 30 to 70 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 2500 m. The southeasterly wind will transport the snow.
The wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack. Intensive rain to intermediate altitudes: The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to rapid moistening of the snowpack.

avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of the snowfall the size of the avalanche prone locations will increase in the late morning. The avalanches can release the moist old snow as well and reach large size. This applies in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. The fresh snow and the wind slabs can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant,. Up to 2000 m rain will fall from late morning. As the moisture increases medium-sized and large moist and wet avalanches are to be expected, especially at low and intermediate altitudes. Wet avalanches can reach a long way in particular in steep gullies. Ski touring and snowshoe hiking call for experience and a certain restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Gradual increase in danger of dry and wet avalanches as a consequence of the precipitation.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 20 to 40 cm of snow will fall above approximately 2500 m. The southeasterly wind will transport the snow.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack. Rain to intermediate altitudes: The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack.

tendency.comment: On Thursday as a consequence of the precipitation there will be a gradual increase in the danger.

avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of the precipitation the size of the avalanche prone locations will increase in the late morning. In particular on very steep slopes the avalanches can release the moist old snow as well and reach quite a large size. This applies in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. The fresh snow and the sometimes large wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant. Above approximately 2500 m in some localities danger level 4 (high) will be reached. Up to 2100 m rain will fall from late morning. As the moisture increases medium-sized and large moist and wet avalanches are to be expected, especially at low and intermediate altitudes. Wet avalanches can reach a long way in particular in steep gullies. Ski touring and snowshoe hiking call for experience and a certain restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Significant increase in danger of dry and wet avalanches as a consequence of the precipitation.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 30 to 60 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 2500 m. The southeasterly wind will transport the snow.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack. Intensive rain to intermediate altitudes: The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack.

avalancheActivity.comment: Up to 2100 m rain will fall from late morning. As the moisture increases medium-sized and large moist and wet avalanches are to be expected, especially at low and intermediate altitudes. Wet avalanches can reach a long way in particular in steep gullies. As a consequence of the precipitation the size of the avalanche prone locations will increase in the late morning. In particular on very steep slopes the avalanches can release the moist old snow as well and reach quite a large size. This applies in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. The fresh snow and the sometimes large wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant. The avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wet snow represent the main danger. Moist and wet avalanches are to be expected already in the early morning.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 30 to 40 cm of snow, but less in some localities, will fall above approximately 2500 m. The southeasterly wind will transport the snow.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack. Intensive rain to intermediate altitudes: The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack.
